PATHANAMTHITTA

Pathanamthitta

is a district in the south-eastern part of Kerala, known for its natural beauty, religious significance, and cultural diversity. It is a place where you can experience the heritage, festivals, and cuisine of Kerala, as well as enjoy the scenic forests, waterfalls, and hills. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Pathanamthitta district that you can visit:

Sabarimala

This is one of the most famous and sacred Hindu pilgrimage sites in India, dedicated to Lord Ayyappa, the son of Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu. The temple is located on a hilltop, surrounded by dense forest, and is accessible only by foot. The temple attracts millions of devotees every year, especially during the Makaravilakku festival, which is celebrated in January. The temple is also known for its strict rules of celibacy, austerity, and vegetarianism for the pilgrims

Aranmula

This is a heritage village and a cultural hub in Pathanamthitta district, famous for its Parthasarathy Temple, Aranmula Kannadi, and Aranmula Vallamkali. The Parthasarathy Temple is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Krishna, who is worshipped as the charioteer of Arjuna in the Mahabharata. The temple is also one of the 108 Divya Desams, or holy abodes of Lord Vishnu. The Aranmula Kannadi is a unique and exquisite mirror made of metal, and is a symbol of craftsmanship and tradition. The Aranmula Vallamkali is a spectacular snake boat race, held on the Pampa River, during the Onam festival. The race is a tribute to Lord Krishna, and is a display of unity and harmony among the villagers

Konni

This is a forested and hilly region in Pathanamthitta district, known for its elephant training centre, ecotourism, and adventure activities. The elephant training centre is a place where wild elephants are captured and trained by the forest department. You can watch the elephants being fed, bathed, and trained, and also learn about their behaviour and conservation. The ecotourism is a program that offers various activities, such as trekking, camping, boating, and wildlife watching, in the natural surroundings of Konni. You can also visit the nearby attractions, such as the Adavi Eco-Tourism, the Achankovil River, and the Muringamangalam Sree Mahadeva Temple

Perunthenaruvi Waterfall

This is a scenic and serene waterfall located on the Pamba River, near Vechoochira village. The name of the waterfall means “the honey river”, and the waterfall is about 60 to 100 feet high. The waterfall is surrounded by dense forest, and has a natural pool at its base. It is a great spot for swimming, picnicking, and relaxing .
